The incident took place in the Makerkote area and a video of the same has also surfaced. One labourer has died while around nine others are still feared trapped in the tunnel.

350.title: Rishi Sunak, wife Akshata enter 'UK Rich List' with combined £730 million wealth
350.article_body: UK Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and his wife Akshata Murty have been included in The Sunday Times Rich List of the UK's wealthiest 250 people for the first time. The couple has ranked 222nd in the list with a combined fortune of £730 million. Akshata Murty, the daughter of Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, owns about 0.9% stake in Infosys.

351.title: Committed to ensuring security of Chinese nationals in Pak: PM
351.article_body: Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif said that his government is committed to providing the highest level of security to all Chinese institutions and nationals working in Pakistan. Sharif made the remarks in a statement issued after his meeting with a Chinese delegation led by External Security Commissioner Cheng Guoping. Notably, a terror attack in Karachi last month killed three Chinese teachers.

352.title: WHO calls for emergency meet amid rise in monkeypox cases: Report
352.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has called for an emergency meeting to discuss the rapidly growing monkeypox outbreak, British publication The Telegraph said on Friday. This comes hours after France, Germany and Belgium confirmed their first cases. Other countries that have detected monkeypox cases include the UK, US, Portugal, Sweden, Spain and Italy.

353.title: I will play in IPL 2023, it'll be unfair to not play in Chennai & say 'Thank you': MSD
353.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni has said that he will "definitely" play in IPL 2023, adding, "It's a simple reason. It will be unfair to not play in Chennai and say 'Thank you'." He added, "Hopefully next year it'll be an opportunity where the teams will be travelling so it will be like a thank you to all the different venues."

354.title: Matthew Wade reprimanded for angrily throwing helmet and bat in dressing room
354.article_body: GT's Matthew Wade has been reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct during his team's match against RCB at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Wade was seen angrily throwing his helmet and bat in the dressing room following his dismissal following a review for LBW. Wade has accepted the sanction, the IPL said.

355.title: I've forgiven everyone who hurt me: Indrani after being released from jail
355.article_body: Former media executive Indrani Mukerjea was released from a Mumbai jail on Friday, almost seven years after being arrested in her daughter Sheena Bora's murder case in 2015. "I am very happy," said Mukerjea while leaving Byculla Jail, adding, "Empathy and forgiveness...I have forgiven all the people who have hurt me." She said she has learned "a lot" in jail.

356.title: Ancient vase kept in kitchen in UK sells for ₹14 crore, pic surfaces
356.article_body: A rare 18th century Chinese vase bought in 1980s for a few hundred pounds has been auctioned for almost £1.5 million (over ₹14 crore). It was purchased by a surgeon and passed from the original owner to his son, who, not realising its true value positioned it in his kitchen. Its value was revealed when an antiques specialist spotted it.

357.title: Shastri's photoshoot pics go viral, says 'Family lives in Mumbai, I live in the moment'
357.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri took to Twitter to share pictures from a photoshoot, which later went viral with fans turning his posts into memes. Shastri captioned one of his pictures, "My family lives in Mumbai and I live in the moment." "Good mornings are optional if you haven't slept at all," he wrote alongside another picture.

358.title: It's in illegally-occupied area: Govt on reports of 2nd Chinese bridge on Pangong
358.article_body: The government has issued a statement on reports of a second Chinese bridge being constructed across the Pangong Lake in Ladakh by China. "Both these bridges are in areas that have continued to be under illegal occupation of China since the 1960s," said the government. "We've never accepted such illegal occupation of our territory," it added.

359.title: Vendors caught littering leftover flowers fined: Hyderabad Mayor
359.article_body: The Mayor of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation said that vendors and other persons were fined after they were caught littering leftover flowers, despite repeated notices served to them. Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal added that the intention behind this was to keep the surroundings tidy. "Swachh Survekshan is everyone's social responsibility," she tweeted.

360.title: Nepal reports its first cases of African swine fever
360.article_body: Nepal has reported its first cases of African swine fever, the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE) said on Thursday. The fever has so far killed 934 pigs in six municipalities in Kathmandu Valley, according to a OIE report. The country has 1,426 susceptible and 1,364 active cases of the fever as of Thursday evening, the report said.

361.title: CSK to bat first against RR in their last IPL 2022 match, Rayudu returns to playing XI
361.article_body: CSK captain MS Dhoni won the toss and elected to bat first against RR in their last IPL 2022 match on Friday. Both the teams have made one change each to their playing XIs. Ambati Rayudu returns to the playing XI for CSK in place of Shivam Dube, while Shimron Hetmyer has replaced Jimmy Neesham in RR's playing XI.

362.title: Oscar-winning Greek composer Vangelis dies at the age of 79
362.article_body: Greek composer Vangelis, who won Oscars for the music of 'Chariots of Fire' and 'Blade Runner', died aged 79 on Tuesday. As per reports, Vangelis died in a hospital in France where he was being treated for COVID-19. The composer had homes in London, Paris and Athens. Vangelis was self-taught in music and claimed he never learnt to read notes.

363.title: Gyanesh Bharti appointed as Commissioner of Unified MCD
363.article_body: The Home Affairs Ministry has announced that 1998 batch IAS officer Gyanesh Bharti has been appointed as the Commissioner of the Unified Municipal Corporation of Delhi. Meanwhile, Ashwani Kumar has been appointed as the Special Officer in the Unified MCD. The South, North and East civic bodies will be treated as one Municipal Corporation of Delhi from May 22.

364.title: Man killed with an axe in Palghar, accused arrested
364.article_body: Police said that a 28-year-old man identified as Sainath Jadhav was killed with an axe at Nalasopara in Maharashtra's Palghar in the early hours of Friday. The victim was killed by 18-year-old Roopesh Thackeray when Jadhav tried to rescue his relative from being attacked, the police added. The accused was later arrested by Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police.

365.title: Massive fire at godown in Delhi's Jhandewalan, 27 tenders reach spot
365.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a godown in the Jhandewalan area of Delhi on Friday. As many as 27 fire tenders reached the spot and the blaze was brought under control. Informing about the same, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain said that no injuries or casualties were reported in the fire, which reportedly broke out at around 2.05 pm.

366.title: Pune civic body to set up centralised command centre for civic issues
366.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is setting up Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) to address all civic grievances. The ICCC will also act as a centre to monitor disaster management and traffic movement, according to a report. "It would be citizen oriented and enable quick response to citizens' concerns," Deputy Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Patil said.

367.title: 2 held for extorting ₹18,000 by posing as policemen in Bhayandar
367.article_body: Two men who posed as policemen and extorted ₹18,000 from a grocer were arrested by Bhayandar Police. The incident occurred on May 3 when the victim was on his way to deliver goods and was stopped by the duo, who accused him of selling banned gutka. They then snatched the money from him and fled.

368.title: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea rejected
368.article_body: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea in connection with a money laundering case filed by Enforcement Directorate was rejected by a special court. Through his lawyer, Sachin Waze sought bail, saying he was not arrested during the probe and keeping him in custody was unnecessary. ED prosecutor said other crimes registered against Waze should be considered.

369.title: I request Sehwag to be mindful while making such statements: Akhtar on 'chucking' remark
369.article_body: After Virender Sehwag stated Shoaib Akhtar used to chuck while bowling, the ex-Pakistan pacer said, "I'd request Sehwag to not pass such comments. If Sehwag knows more than ICC...he's entitled to his opinion." He added, "Cricketers should make sure their statements don't disturb...harmony between India & Pakistan. I request Sehwag to be mindful while making such statements in...social media age."

370.title: India's annual FDI inflow hits all-time high of $83.57 billion in 2021-22
370.article_body: India's annual FDI (foreign direct investment) inflow hit an all-time high of $83.57 billion in the financial year 2021-22, the Ministry of Commerce & Industry said on Friday. The Ministry said that the highest-ever annual FDI inflow has been recorded despite military operation in Ukraine and COVID-19 pandemic. In 2020-21, the FDI inflow in India stood at $81.97 billion.

371.title: Depp was controlling, said I got a scratch from sex with another person: Ex-girlfriend
371.article_body: Johnny Depp was jealous, controlling and frequently drunk, his ex-girlfriend, actress Ellen Barkin, said in testimony. "I had a scratch on my back once that got him very, very angry because he insisted it came from me having sex with a person who wasn't him," she added. Barkin said she had a brief "sexual relationship" with Depp in the 1990s.

372.title: 16 pvt schools to shut in GB Nagar for operating without recognition
372.article_body: GB Nagar's education department released list of 16 private schools which were running without recognition certificates in the district and directed for their closure with immediate effect. The private schools that have been found violating the rules are located at Garhi Chaukhandi, Mamura, Raipur Bangar, Maincha, Nangla Nainsukh, Salarpur, Madalpur, Jhajhar Road, Bhaipur Brahmanan and Wajidpur.

373.title: Jet Airways gets DGCA nod to resume flight operations after 3 years
373.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has granted the air operator's certificate (AOC) to Jet Airways, allowing the grounded carrier to resume commercial flight operations after three years. The airline successfully conducted all its proving flights, reportedly with DGCA officials onboard, this week. Earlier, the Ministry of Home Affairs had granted security clearance to Jet Airways.

374.title: ₹25,000 monthly salary is among top 10% incomes earned in India: Report
374.article_body: A monthly salary of ₹25,000 is among the top 10% of incomes earned in India, The State of Inequality Report released by the Economic Advisory Council to the PM (EAC-PM) has said. Citing the 2018-19 and 2019-20 data from the Periodic Labour Force Survey, the report said nearly 15% of the working population earned less than ₹5,000 per month.

375.title: Got bruises on arms, legs shooting 'Designer': Divya Khosla Kumar
375.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Divya Khosla Kumar, who was seen in 'Designer' with Guru Randhawa and Yo Yo Honey Singh, said that she got bruises on her arms and legs while shooting. "There was one outfit...made out of...metal. Along with that...I had inches long nail extensions...I couldn't sit during the shoot because of my outfit! It was a...shoot of seven hours," she added.

376.title: HC orders company to pay ₹10 lakh to terminated employee in B'luru
376.article_body: Karnataka HC has directed a Bengaluru-based company to pay a ₹10 lakh compensation to the employee who was terminated after he declined to undergo a performance improvement program. Since the employee was terminated without holding an enquiry, he's eligible for compensation, it said. However, it didn't allow his reinstatement to the job due to loss of mutual trust with employer.

377.title: Seema drops 'Khan' surname after filing for divorce from Sohail
377.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Seema has dropped the 'Khan' surname from her social media accounts and returned to her maiden name Seema Kiran Sajdeh. This comes a week after she filed for divorce from actor-filmmaker Sohail Khan after 24 years of marriage. Rumours about their separation began when the couple was shown as living separately on the show.

378.title: Amazon, Flipkart in talks to buy stake in $1.1 bn Metropolis Healthcare: Report
378.article_body: Diagnostics chain Metropolis Healthcare is reportedly looking to raise over $300 million and bring onboard a strategic partner by selling a significant minority stake. While Flipkart and Apollo Hospitals are among potential investors, Amazon has held preliminary discussions, Bloomberg reported. Metropolis currently has a market value of $1.1 billion, about half of what it was at the start of 2022.

379.title: Dave Chappelle's attacker charged with attempted murder in separate case
379.article_body: Isaiah Lee, who attacked comedian Dave Chappelle onstage during a performance with a replica gun and knife, has been charged with attempted murder in a separate case. The 23-year-old allegedly stabbed his roommate during a fight at a transitional housing apartment in December last year, police said. Police added that publicity from Dave Chappelle's attack helped them solve this case.

380.title: 18-year-old girl dies as her burqa gets stuck in bike wheel in Hyd
380.article_body: An 18-year-old girl fell from a motorcycle after her burqa got stuck in the motorcycle's rear wheel in Hyderabad. She received major injuries and succumbed to death, while her brother, who was driving the motorcycle, survived the accident with no injuries. Sharing a video of the accident, TSRTC MD, VC Sajjanar, tweeted, "Women...be careful when you sit on a bike."

381.title: SC lifts stay on Delhi HC order on right to feed stray dogs
381.article_body: Supreme Court has vacated a stay on the Delhi High Court order, which said that "stray dogs have the right to food and citizens have the right to feed them". The verdict comes as a relief to animal welfare organisations involved in feeding stray dogs. The Supreme Court had put the stay on the HC order on an NGO's plea.

382.title: Rachakonda Police conduct awareness programme for poultry workers
382.article_body: She Teams of Rachakonda Police conducted an awareness programme in Vanasthalipuram regarding cybercrimes, human trafficking, gender sensitisation, child marriage, child labour and child abuse. The awareness programme was conducted for poultry farm workers of the locality, who were asked to dial 100 if they came across such incidents. The Rachakonda Police tweeted about the awareness programme.

383.title: Pune's SPPU prepares development plan for Sindhudurg district
383.article_body: Eighteen departments of Pune's Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) have prepared a development report for Sindhudurg district. "We have chosen this district considering...climate change and the need for infrastructure," the project's coordinator said. Notably, the report highlights road connectivity as a major challenge and recommends building of cold storage facilities to promote aquaculture.

384.title: Happy that people have accepted the choices I made: Kartik Aaryan
384.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, while talking about choosing a particular role or a film, said he is happy that people have accepted the choices he made till date. "It's the energy that people are catching up on," he said. Further, while talking about breaking his image of a monologue boy from 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', Kartik said that he made conscious decisions.

385.title: Margot Robbie to star in 'Ocean's Eleven' prequel movie: Reports
385.article_body: Margot Robbie is set to play the lead role in a prequel to the crime drama film 'Ocean's Eleven', according to reports. Jay Roach, who previously worked with Robbie in film 'Bombshell', has been roped in to direct the forthcoming project, reports stated. 'Ocean's Eleven', which was released in 2001, featured Brad Pitt, George Clooney and Julia Roberts, among others.

386.title: Ketan Mehta, Anubhav Sinha team up for film on freedom fighter Usha Mehta
386.article_body: Filmmakers Ketan Mehta and Anubhav Sinha have teamed up for 'Freedom Radio', an upcoming film based on the life of freedom fighter Usha Mehta. It'll be helmed by Ketan, while Anubhav will be producing it under his production banner Benaras Mediaworks. Usha Mehta started a radio station, Secret Congress Radio, during the Quit India Movement in 1942.

387.title: MP man arrested for making 7,000 fake Aadhaar cards in Hyderabad
387.article_body: Officials said that a man who had fled after making over 7,000 fake Aadhaar cards in Hyderabad, was arrested by the police's Cyber Cell in Indore. Police said that the accused, Pawan Kotiya, who had two cases registered against him, was handed over to the Hyderabad Police. His eight aides were arrested by Hyderabad Police a few days ago.

388.title: She's a far-left actor: Musk on friend of air hostess who accused him of sexual harassment
388.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the friend of the flight attendant who has accused him of sexual harassment "is a far-left activist/actress in LA with a major political axe to grind." In a report, the flight attendant's friend accused Musk of exposing himself and offering to buy a horse for her friend in exchange for an erotic massage in 2016.

389.title: CSK made a lot of mistakes, captaincy issue created lot of confusion: Akhtar
389.article_body: Talking about CSK, former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar said, "They have made a lot of mistakes and their dressing room never looked intact in IPL 2022." "The captaincy issue created a lot of confusion," added Akhtar. "CSK's management didn't look serious about IPL 2022. If MS Dhoni leaves they are left with nothing," he had earlier stated.

390.title: Nearly 2,000 Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol have surrendered: Russia
390.article_body: Nearly 2,000 soldiers holed up in Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, the last bastion of Ukrainian resistance in the city, have surrendered to Russian forces so far, Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu said. Those who have surrendered have been taken to Russian-controlled areas. Ukraine, which is aiming to secure a prisoner swap, said efforts are on to evacuate the remaining defenders.

391.title: Rapper Lil Nas X to be honoured with 2022 Hal David Starlight Award
391.article_body: Rapper Lil Nas X will be honoured with Hal David Starlight Award at the 2022 Songwriters Hall of Fame ceremony. The award recognises young songwriters making significant impact in the music industry through their original songs. At the age of 23, Lil Nas X will become one of the youngest recipients of the award after Taylor Swift and Nick Jonas.

392.title: Nigerian man arrested with 400 gram of MDMA worth ₹60 lakh in Mumbai
392.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of Mumbai's Bandra arrested a Nigerian man from Goregaon and recovered 400 gram of MDMA from his possession. According to Datta Nalawade, DCP, Anti-Narcotics Cell, the seized drug is worth ₹60 lakh in the international market. Earlier in April, another Nigerian national was arrested in Mumbai with 750 gram MDMA worth ₹1.12 crore.

393.title: Sexual harassment story meant to interfere with Twitter acquisition: Musk
393.article_body: After a report claimed Tesla CEO Elon Musk allegedly sexually harassed a flight attendant employed by SpaceX in 2016, he said that the story was meant to "interfere with the Twitter acquisition". Responding to a follower who asked if he responded to the writers of the story, Musk replied, "The story was written before they even talked to me."

394.title: Trolling part of life: Dalip on Big B, Akshay's trolling over pan masala
394.article_body: Veteran actor Dalip Tahil has reacted to Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar being trolled over endorsing pan masala brands, saying that trolling is a part of life. "If you don't want to be trolled, don't go on social media," the actor added. Dalip further said that trolling is also publicity for some actors who were not recognised before social media.

395.title: Poonam Dhillon's daughter Paloma to debut opposite Sunny Deol's son Rajveer
395.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon's daughter Paloma Thakeria is set to make her Bollywood debut opposite Rajveer Deol, the younger son of actor Sunny Deol, in Rajshri Productions' upcoming project. It will also mark filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya's son Avnish Barjatya's debut as a director. The yet-untitled film is reportedly set against the backdrop of a lavish destination wedding.

396.title: There's not a lot that has gone my way in IPL 2022: RCB's Maxwell
396.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said there is not a lot that has gone his way in IPL 2022, having scored 268 runs so far in the ongoing edition. "To be able to influence the game in different areas of the contest is what I try to do," added Maxwell. The all-rounder has scored one half-century till now in IPL 2022.

397.title: Kept searching for fours despite a close shave: Harbhajan on Kohli's 73 vs GT
397.article_body: Discussing RCB batter Virat Kohli's 73 off 54 balls against GT, ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh said, "Kohli fought...and in an interesting fashion." "There was a close shave...a catch was dropped in the deep but that didn't stop his attitude. He kept on searching [for] fours, the day he searches [for] fours Kohli's attitude is like this, attacking mode," added Harbhajan.

398.title: He's been going to temples for yrs: Man who was booked for taking pet dog to Kedarnath
398.article_body: A Noida man booked for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by making his pet dog touch an idol at the Kedarnath shrine said he's been taking his pet dog to temples for the past four years. "Why is this drama happening now suddenly?" said Vikash Tyagi on Instagram. He also shared an old video of his dog at Badrinath and Tungnath.

399.title: Archer ruled out of English summer 2022 after suffering back stress fracture
399.article_body: England pacer Jofra Archer has been ruled out of this year's English summer due to a lower back stress fracture. The England and Wales Cricket Board confirmed that the 27-year-old pacer will not be available to play until the end of September at the earliest. However, no timeframe has been set for Archer's return, ECB said.

400.title: 3 held for assaulting man on suspicion of theft in Gwalior
400.article_body: Three persons were held for allegedly thrashing a man on suspicion of theft in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. A video had surfaced where the accused had tied the victim, covered his eyes and assaulted him in the Falka Bazaar area, Gwalior SP Amit Sanghi said. Notably, the arrests were made after the police questioned some people from the area.

401.title: Kangana Ranaut buys Mercedes Maybach worth over ₹3 crore, pic surfaces
401.article_body: Kangana Ranaut on Thursday attended the premiere of her upcoming film 'Dhaakad' and unveiled her latest purchase, the Mercedes Maybach S680 worth over ₹3 crore. Pictures and videos of Kangana unveiling her new car have been shared online. A video shows Kangana clapping as two people removed the cover of the car.
